content:
• Thursday, June 7, 2018
  • ZUMZ

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/07/2018)

    • Gainers: ZUMZ +12.9%. DOCU +6.8%. SFIX +6.7%. AVYA +2.6%. CBLK +1.5%.
    • Losers: NBR -1.6%. NOAH -1.6%. BSBR -1.4%. TVIX -1.1%. HOME -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • ITI

    Iteris -4.5% as hurricane effect weighs on revenues, profits

    • Iteris (NASDAQ:ITI) is off 4.5% after hours following a miss in fiscal Q4 earnings where it posted a worse-than-expected loss amid flat revenues affected by Hurricane Harvey.
    • During the quarter, "our Roadway Sensors segment continued to encounter choppiness in Texas, as Houston and other Gulf Coast cities rebalanced reconstruction priorities against previously planned improvement projects in the aftermath of last year’s unprecedented weather disasters,” said CEO Joe Bergera.
    • He expects the company will be a net beneficiary of regional reconstruction spending in the long term.
    • Operating expenses fell to $12.8M from $13.4M. Operating loss narrowed to $2.8M from $3.5M.
    • Net loss narrowed, but not as much as expected: to $2.4M, vs. a year-ago loss of $3.4M.
    • Revenues by segment: Roadway sensors, $10.77M (down 4.4%); Transportation Systems, $13.09M (up 3.6%); Ag & Weather Analytics, $1.41M (up 0.6%).
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • ADMA

    ADMA Bio launches stock offering; shares down 4% after hours

    • ADMA Biologics (NASDAQ:ADMA) slips 4% after hours in response to its planned stock offering. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • MVIS

    MicroVision -9.1% on proposed $18M stock offering, new COO

    • MicroVision (NASDAQ:MVIS) announces plans for a public $18M common stock offering.
    • MicroVision plans to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes including working capital and capital expenditures. 
    • The offering will be priced next week. 
    • The company also announces appointing Sumit Sharma to the newly created COO position. Sharma was previously the company’s VP of engineering and operations. 
    • MicroVision shares are down 9.1% aftermarket to $1.43.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • TRXC

    TransEnterix files U.S. marketing application for Senhance instruments for micro-procedures; shares up 2% after hours

    • TransEnterix (NYSEMKT:TRXC) is up 2% after hours on the heels of its announcement that it has filed a 510(k) submission with the FDA seeking clearance for additional Senhance System instruments, including 3 mm diameter, for use in microlaparoscopic surgeries.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 8 Comments
  • CREE

    Cree -3.3% on CFO transition, reaffirmed guidance

    • Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) announces that CFO Mike McDevitt will retire from his positions once a successor is appointed.
    • McDevitt will remain available as a consultant to help with the transition. 
    • Cree also reaffirms its Q4 guidance with revenue from $390M to $410M and EPS of $0.05 to $0.09. 
    • Cree shares are down 3.3% aftermarket ot $48.10.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • SFIX

    Stitch Fix +10% on guidance lift

    • Stitch Fix (NASDAQ:SFIX) is up 10% in AH trading after giving a slight push higher to the retailer's full-year revenue guidance.
    • The company expects FY18 revenue of $1.22B to $1.23B vs. $1.19B to $1.22B prior and $1.21B consensus.
    • Stitch Fix says the number of active clients rose 30% Y/Y in FQ3 to 2.7M.
    • CEO update: "We continue to balance growth and profitability, demonstrated by our ability to consistently deliver top-line growth of over 20% even as we invest in category expansions, technology talent, and marketing. Our third quarter results demonstrate continued positive momentum for Stitch Fix and the power of our unique ability to deliver personalized service at scale."
    • Previously: Stitch Fix beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (June 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 21 Comments
  • CBLK

    Carbon Black +1.1% on Q1 beats, upside guides

    • Carbon Black (NASDAQ:CBLK) gains 1.1% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 35% Y/Y revenue growth. The report was Carbon Black’s first since the IPO.
    • Upside Q2 guidance has revenue of $48.5M to $49M (consensus: $48.21M) and EPS from -$0.41 to -$0.42 (consensus: -$0.43). 
    • Upside FY18 guidance has revenue from $203M to $204.5M (consensus: $202.01M) and EPS from -$1.32 to -$1.35 (consensus: -$1.38).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.   
    • Press release.    
    • Previously: Carbon Black beats by $0.29, beats on revenue (June 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine beats by $0.02, misses on revenue

    • Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST): FY EPS of -$0.20 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $82.84M (+7.3% Y/Y) misses by $0.76M.
    • Shares +1.6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • ADRO

    Aduro Bio announces launch of early-stage study of ADU-214 in lung cancer

    • Aduro Biotech (NASDAQ:ADRO) announces that licensee Janssen Biotech (NYSE:JNJ) has initiated a Phase 1b clinical trial assessing ADU-214, combined with Bristol-Myers Squibb's (NYSE:BMY) Opdivo (nivolumab), in patients with advanced/metastatic non-small cell lung cancer, specifically, mesothelin-positive relapsed/refractory Stage IIIB or Stage IV adenocarcinoma of the lung.
    • The primary endpoint of  the 170-subject study is objective response rate (ORR) at every eight-week time point during year 1 and every 12 weeks thereafter. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated primary completion date is October 2020.
    • ADU-214 is based on Aduro's LADD technology platform. LADD (live-attenuated double-deleted) Listeria monocytogenes are strains of bacteria that are engineered to induce a potent innate immune response and to express tumor-associated antigens to induce tumor-specific T-cell-mediated immunity.
    • Shares are up 1% after hours.
    • Previously: Aduro bags $22.4M in LADD-related milestones from Janssen Biotech (Feb. 1, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • DOCU

    DocuSign +10.7% on first earnings after IPO beats estimates with upside guide

    • DocuSign (NASDAQ:DOCU) gains 10.7% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates in the first report since the IPO. Revenue grew 37% Y/Y to $155.8M.   
    • Guidance: Upside Q2 has revenue from $157M to $160M (consensus: $151.5M). Upside FY19 has revenue from $652M to $658M (consensus: $627.6M).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: DocuSign beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (June 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 10 Comments
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q1 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $206.29M (+13.9% Y/Y) beats by $6.95M.
    • Shares +2.59%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • SFIX

    Stitch Fix beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • Stitch Fix (NASDAQ:SFIX): Q3 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $316.74M (+29.2% Y/Y) beats by $10.39M.
    • Shares +11.08%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • DOCU

    DocuSign beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • DocuSign (NASDAQ:DOCU): Q1 EPS of $0.01 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $155.8M (+37.3% Y/Y) beats by $9.64M.
    • Shares +3.59%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 3 Comments
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy -10% after Q2 earnings miss expectations

    • FuelCell Energy (FCEL -9.6%) tumbles nearly 10% after posting a larger than expected Q2 loss on a 2% Y/Y increase in revenues to $20.8M
    • Q2 gross margin came in at -3% compared to a gross margin of 1.9% for the year-ago quarter, hurt by an under-absorption of fixed overhead costs due to low production volumes; annualized Q2 production rate was 25 MW, vs. 35 MW in the same quarter a year ago.
    • FCEL's contracted backlog totaled a record $682M as of April 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • IIPR

    Innovative Industrial +3%, up 18% year-to-date

    • Innovative Industrial Properties (NYSE:IIPR) +3.3% to $37.91 with 174,531 shares traded in late afternoon trading, more than its three-month daily average of 123, 468.
    • No obvious news to explain today's bump in the stock.
    • IIPR's 52-week high, also its all-time record, was $38.89 just three days ago; shares of the REIT that buys properties and leases them to operators of medical-use cannabis facilities have risen 18% YTD.
    • Previously: Innovative Industrial to invest up to $18.5M for medical cannabis site in MA (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • MDB

    MongoDB -3.3% despite Q1 revenue beat, raised price targets

    • Stifel raises its MongoDB (NASDAQ:MDB) price target from $47 to $53 after the earnings report.
    • Firm continues to believe the company can drive healthy double-digit recurring revenue growth of at least 30% and will improve profitability in the coming years. 
    • Needham raises its MongoDB target from $52 to $57 and calls the company an emerging industry leader with strong products attacking a large market opportunity. 
    • More target increases: Monness Crespi Hardt, $51 to $60; Canaccord Genuity, $45 to $54; Barclays, $47 to $57. 
    • MongoDB shares are down 3.3%.     
    • Previously: MongoDB -2.5% on Q1 that met on EPS, in-line EPS guide (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • NOV

    National Oilwell gets Raymond James price target boost on growth story

    • National Oilwell Varco (NOV +1.4%) is higher after Raymond James maintains its Outperform rating and raises its stock price target to $47 from $42 after the firm spent time with the company at a recent Boston conference.
    • NOV is uniquely positioned for a multi-year oilfield growth story, Ray Jay analyst Marshall Adkins says, citing more confidence in potential upside to the firm's model in the Wellbore Technologies segment.
    • Adkins thinks green shoots in offshore activity also could finally spark a recovery for NOV’s Rig Technologies segment.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • FSLR

    Solar industry headed for downturn after Chinese policy shift, Goldman says

    • Solar stocks are mostly lower as the industry continues to reel from China's surprise move to curb incentives for solar power.
    • In an industry that has long been governed by boom-and-bust cycles, Goldman Sachs now forecasts a 40% drop in sales volumes in China, which accounts for half of the global market for solar modules and other equipment, and expects supplies across the entire global supply chain to rise by 12%-32%.
    • "Against this backdrop, we see both volume and pricing risk intensifying in the near-to-medium term, and now forecast 0% average upside across the group," Goldman writes.
    • First Solar (FSLR -4.3%), whose shares have plunged 23% since China's policy shift, was slapped with Sell rating and a $48 price target, slashed from $75; the firm also cut its price targets for Jinko Solar (JKS -0.7%) to $10 from $15 and Canadian Solar (CSIQ -2.3%) to $13 form $18.
    • Credit Suisse cut price targets for FSLR to $53 from $59, JKS to $13 from $22 and SunPower (SPWR -0.7%) to $8 from $8.50, but reiterated an Outperform rating and $15 price target on Sunrun (RUN -1.6%).
    • Credit Suisse's Michael Weinstein thinks RUN can do well thanks to battery and grid services technologies that will "will disrupt utility incumbency," and says RUN's contracts with consumers are on favorable terms that should benefit shareholders.
    • ETFs: TAN, KWT
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 47 Comments
  • FB

    Recode: Facebook bug exposed private posts of up to 14M

    • On the privacy beat at Facebook (FB -1.7%): The company's defense during high-profile hearings over its data-leak scandal has been that users have total control over whether they're sharing info with friends or the world. But a bug may have exposed privately shared info of up to 14M users, Recode says.
    • A bug live for 10 days in May updated the audience for some users' posts to "public" without warning; the audience setting is "sticky" in the sense that it stays with the last set audience, and users may not have realized they were sharing info publicly.
    • Facebook says it's beginning today to alert people who were impacted. The company says the issue has been fixed.
    • “We’d like to apologize for this mistake,” says Chief Privacy Officer Erin Egan.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 35 Comments

  • Mini-flash crash in bond yields

    • The 10-year Treasury yield tumbled from about 2.95% to 2.88% in the space of a few minutes earlier this afternoon.
    • Cited among the search for excuses is the continuing meltdown in Brazil, with the central bank earlier today stepping in to try and stem the slide in the real. There's also speculation about a "fat-finger" error.
    • Yields have moved higher over the past hour, with the 10-year Treasury yield now off four basis points for the day at 2.93%. TLT +0.7%, TBT -1.4%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 3 Comments
  • VRNT

    Verint Systems reports Q1 beats, inline revenue guidance

    • Verint Systems (NASDAQ:VRNT) gains 0.1% on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 10% Y/Y revenue growth. FY19 guidance has inline revenue from $1.21B to $1.25B (consensus: $1.23B) and upside EPS at -$3.09 (consensus: -$3.12).  Conference call is scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Verint Systems beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (June 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • GOL

    South American airline sector hit by currency woes

    • A sharp drop in the Brazilian real to a multi-year low sends GOL Linhas (GOL -6.6%), LATAM Airlines (LTM -5%), Copa Holdings (COPA -2.6%) and Azul (AZUL -7.9%) into a tailspin.
    • There is some fear of contagion currency devaluation in Central and South America.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • I

    Intelsat -10.8% after shelf registration

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) is off 10.8% after a late shelf registration suggests future equity raises.
    • Shares have more than quadrupled since April 3 amid increasing interest in the company's proposal for monetizing C-band spectrum by sharing it with wireless carriers.
    • Use of proceeds points to general purposes including repaying debt, acquisitions, capex and working capital; the company's talked about using equity for debt repayment, though its nearest maturity comes in late 2020.
    • Previously: Intelsat in multi-year deal to speed Myanmar deployment (Jun. 01 2018)
    • Previously: Intelsat jumps again as CTIA leans on FCC over mid-band progress (May. 31 2018)
    • Previously: SES, Intelsat move as Morgan Stanley embraces C-band proposal (May. 29 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 6 Comments
  • MELI

    Real problems for MELI and ARCO

    • Shares of MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI) are down 7.15% and Arcos Dorados (NYSE:ARCO) is off 6.95% after the Brazilian real sells off to a multi-year low.
    • Both companies have a high level of exposure to the currency.
    • Previously: Brazil banks tank as central bank intervention fails to prop up real (June 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 12 Comments
  • ZS

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/07/2018)

    • Gainers: ZS +20%. VSH +13%. SSTI +11%. HEAR +10%. SCWX +9%.
    • Losers: I -10%. SGH -10%. OTCPK:LFIN -10%. ZUO -7%. SMSI -7%.
      •  
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 5 Comments
  • HTA

    Healthcare Trust of America -2.4% on bearish note from SA contributor

    • Spruce Point Capital's Ben Axler expresses skepticism about the management team at Healthcare Trust of America (HTA -2.4%), and isn't buying the company's same-property NOI metrics.
    • He notes that despite the stock trading at a discount to estimated NAV, the company yesterday told Nareit conference-goers it does not intend to buy back shares. Management themselves own just a tiny fraction of HTA. If insiders and the company aren't buying,  why should the general investing public?
    • Axler calls for an independent third-party review and suggests 20-40% downside risk for the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 15 Comments
  • FGP

    Ferrellgas -3% as quarterly earnings, revenues miss expectations

    • Ferrellgas Partners (FGP -2.9%) slips after reporting weaker than expected FQ3 earnings and a 4% Y/Y decline in revenues to $516M.
    • The decline came even as propane sales volume rose by more than 34M gallons, or 16.1%, Y/Y as margins fell slightly while the company acquired ~11.5K new customers, or 1.7% more than a year ago; FGP’s Blue Rhino tank exchange sales locations increased 9.5% from the start of the fiscal year.
    • FGP says its midstream business "has stabilized and is positioning itself for potential growth opportunities stemming from activity associated with recent increases in the price of oil."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 13 Comments
  • CYBR

    UBS raises its CyberArk target to 10% upside

    • UBS raises its CyberArk Software (NASDAQ:CYBR) price target from $64 to $71, a 10% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Firm maintains a Buy rating. 
    • CyberArk shares are down 0.7% to $63.88.  
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • EQNR

    Equinor, Exxon grab prime offshore stakes in Brazil oil auction

    • Equinor (EQNR +2.5%) and Exxon Mobil (XOM +1.1%) are the most aggressive major oil companies at today's auction of Brazil's pre-salt offshore oil blocks, snapping up stakes despite renewed concerns about political meddling in the country’s energy sector.
    • A consortium of EQNR, XOM and Petroleos de Portugal won the largest block with a $679M signing bonus plus 75.4% of profit oil - more than 3x the minimum bid - for the Uirapuru block in the Santos Basin off the coast of Rio de Janeiro; Brazil's Petrobras (PBR -5.7%) exercised its right to be the operating partner, with a 30% share of the consortium.
    • XOM, one of the few oil majors without stakes in Brazil’s pre-salt geology until late last year, now owns stakes in 25 Brazilian blocks after the auction.
    • Other winning bids came from the likes of Chevron (CVX +2.9%), BP (BP +2%) and Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A +1.3%).
    • Brazil’s cash-strapped government collected 3.15B reais ($800M) in fixed signing bonuses at the auction.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • SBGI

    Sinclair Broadcast re-elects slate at annual meeting

    • Sinclair Broadcast Group's (SBGI +2.3%) annual meeting went by the books, ratifying its auditor and re-electing eight directors to the board.
    • PricewaterhouseCoopers has won ratification as the company's auditor for the fiscal year.
    • And Chairman David Smith, VP Frederick Smith, and Secretary J. Duncan Smith won re-election, along with Robert Smith, Lawrence McCanna, Daniel Keith, Martin Leader, and Howard Friedman.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • FSI

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/07/2018)

    • Gainers: FSI +14%. OSN +10%. EGC +8%. UPL +8%. SN +7%.
    • Losers: SNES -19%. GGB -15%. OTC:ANW -13%. SID -10%. PBR-A -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • RRTS

    Roadrunner Transportation Systems on five-day winning streak

    • Shares of Roadrunner Transportation Systems (NYSE:RRTS) rise 9.0% as positive sentiment stays strong on the logistics services stock.
    • Roadrunner is now up 24% over the last five sessions as shares work back the ground lost due to fear over the Alibaba investment in ZTO Express.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • TLSNY

    Telia +1.9% as Goldman sees 29% upside

    • Telia (OTCPK:TLSNY) is up 1.9% in U.S. trading after an upgrade to Buy at Goldman Sachs.
    • The firm raised its price target to 54 kronor from 41; shares closed today at 41.95 kronor in Stockholm, implying 28.7% upside.
    • Telia ADRs are up 9.8% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • OXBR

    Oxbridge Re plummets to all-time low, down 81% from 52-week high in July

    • Oxbridge Re (NASDAQ:OXBR) dives 16% plunging to $1.05, its all-time low. The company has lost 83% of its market cap since the stock hit its 52-week high of $6 on July 17, 2017.
    • No apparent news to explain today's decline.
    • Update at 4:30 p.m.: OXBR ended regular trading +19% at $1.55.
    • The company does have an investor presentation posted to its website dated June 2018. There's no indication of exactly when it was posted, however it implies that OXBR is meeting with investors this month.
    • Within the slideshow there's a so-called "sidecar" transaction, called Oxbridge Re NS. Under the deal, investors provide the sidecar--Oxbridge Re NS--with capital and the sidecar returns underwriting profits net of management fee to the investors. Oxbridge Re keeps 100% common equity ownership and management of the sidecar.
    • In the slideshow, Oxbridge Re says the sidecar "follows the fortunes of Oxbridge Re" and "investors can earn 18%-25% annual return on his or her investment in a loss-free year"; furthermore, it says "returns are uncorrelated to the financial markets."
    • Oxbridge Re disclosed the formation of the sidecar in its May 15 10-Q filing.  OXBR said it formed the entity "to facilitate potential future hedging and investment activities with respect to our reinsurance risks, but the subsidiary has not yet commenced operations and has no assets or liabilities."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 13 Comments
  • EQNR

    Equinor says governments, energy sector moving 'too slow' on climate

    • The world's governments and oil and gas producers are moving far too slowly to prevent climate change and to meet the goals set in the Paris climate accord, Equinor (EQNR +2.6%) says in its annual Energy Perspectives report.
    • The global electric grid must grow from its ~5% reliance on renewable energy today to nearly 50% in the coming decades, and global oil demand must fall by nearly 40% by 2050 to meet global goals to slow the pace of climate change, according to the report.
    • Major new investments in oil and gas exploration and production still would be required even if oil demand falls 40%, EQNR says, while it plans to increase investments in renewable energy to 15%-20% of its total capex by 2030.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 24 Comments
  • DISH

    Sling TV adds Cheddar's general-news network to lineup

    • Sling TV (DISH +4%) has added Cheddar Big News to its lineup.
    • The new offering -- a general-news spin-out from Cheddar, which started with business news targeted to younger viewers -- is being added into Sling Orange and Blue packages at no extra cost.
    • They join Cheddar's base network in both packages. In 2016, Sling was the first service to add Cheddar.
    • Meanwhile, an SEC filing from last night shows Dish director and executive VP James DeFranco added 10,000 shares at $29.20 each as part of a 10b5-1 trading plan.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • MFIN

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/07/2018)

    • Gainers: MFIN +8%. CWH +8%. BHLB +7%. IHT +5%.
    • Losers: OXBR -16%. BSBR -10%. PAGS -10%. ITUB -7%. BBD -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • OPTN

    OptiNose prices offering at $22.25/share

    • OptiNose (OPTN -3.5%) prices offering of common stock by company and selling share holders at $22.25/share.
    • Previously: OptiNose readies stock offering (June 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • PG

    Nelson Peltz gains traction at Procter & Gamble

    • Shares Procter & Gamble (PG +2.6%) gain after an appearance by Nelson Peltz on CNBC included the activist investor claiming that his P&G reorganization plan is gaining traction.
    • Peltz said that even the Procter board has been welcoming about his overtures.
    • Peltz's Trian Partners holds a 3.5% stake in P&G.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 21 Comments
  • OPHT

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/07/2018)

    • Gainers: OPHT +54%. AXON +35%. AVHI +29%. ZS +28%. FIVE +22%. CONN +22%. AETI +21%. JVA +16%. MRTX +16%. SONC +15%.
    • Losers: PTI -34%. OTC:MDXG -24%. REVG -22%. SNES -17%. OXBR -16%. AMSC -15%. OTC:RSLS -15%. UNFI -14%. OTC:ANW -13%. GFA -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • OKTA

    Okta -4.2% despite price target boosts after earnings beat

    • Canaccord Genuity maintains a Buy rating and raises its Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) target from $55 to $60.
    • Firm says Okta is succeeding at creating broader “concentric circles of adjacent functionality that extends the firm’s total addressable market without abandoning the core cloud single sign-on market.” 
    • Source: Briefing.com. 
    • More action: Oppenheimer raises its Okta price target from $51 to $60 and maintains an Outperform rating.  
    • Okta shares are down 4.2% despite yesterday’s Q1 beats and upside guidance.  
    • Previously: Okta +2.7% on Q1 beats, upside FY guidance (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 10 Comments
  • PYX

    Alliance One International down 6% post Q4 results

    • Alliance One International (AOI -6%) reported Q4 sales growth of 5.6% Y/Y to $643.85M reflecting an increase in average sales price due to favorable product mix in South America, North America, Asia, and Europe, and an increase in volume.
    • Gross profit was $74.7M up 10.6% Y/Y and gross margins improved by 50 bps to 11.6%.
    • Q4 operating margin declined by 31 bps to 5% and Adj. EBITDA declined by 35 bps to 7.5%
    • SG&A expenses were $46.3M up 32% Y/Y, reflecting higher professional fees associated with “One Tomorrow” business development initiatives.
    • Volumes decreased by 1.7% to 127.6M kilos, driven by larger South American crops and offset by timings of shipments from Asia and shorter weather related crops in Africa.
    • Credit lines and cash were $625.1M as of March 31, 2018.
    • "On April 2, 2018 our subsidiary, AOSP Investments, LCC ("AOSPI") acquired 51% of Humble Juice Company, a fast-growing lifestyle e-liquid brand with high-quality products, great flavors and a broad base of loyal consumers. This investment enhances the potential revenue and profitability of our combined e-liquid businesses, further diversifies our e-liquid product lines and services, and fits cohesively into our value-added business model", mentioned Pieter Sikkel, President and CEO.
    • FY19 Outlook: Sales $1.95-2.05B and Adj. EBITDA $170-190M.
    • Previously: Alliance One reports Q4 results (June 7)

  • HOV

    Hovnanian -8% after Q2 results, suit over Blackstone financing deal resolved

    • Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV -8.5%) falls after the homebuilder reports disappointing earnings and disclosed details on the resolution of a lawsuit relating to a financing transaction with Blackstone's credit platform.
    • FQ2 total revenue fell 14% to $502.5M vs $585.9M a year ago.
    • Number of contracts, including  unconsolidated joint ventures, fell 2.4% to 1,706 homes from 1,748 a year earlier.
    • HOV says declining community count continues to challenge its results. Community count, including unconsolidated joint ventures, at Q2 end was 153, a 10% decline from a year earlier; however, HOV has been able to increase its contracts/community to 11.2 for Q2 vs. 10.3 a year ago.
    • On May 31, 2018, a lawsuit filed by Solus Alternative Asset Management regarding HOV's financing transactions with GSO Capital Partners, Blackstone's credit platform, and certain funds advised by it was dismissed. As a result, K. Hovnanian paid overdue interest on 8.0% senior notes due 2019. The resolution didn't involve any settlement payment or admission of wrongdoing by any HOV-related parties.
    • Last month, HOV drew down about $70.0M on the delayed draw portion of the 5% unsecured term loan maturing in 2027 from the GSO Entities to redeem all outstanding 8% senior notes due 2019 other than the $26M held by a Hovnanian subsidiary. Aggregate principal amount of notes redeemed was approximately $65.7M.
    • Financing commitments agreed upon previously with GSO, which include a $125M senior secured revolver/term loan and $25M tack-on to 10.5% senior secured notes due 2024, remain intact.
    • “Provided there are no adverse changes in current market conditions, we expect further improvements in our operations resulting in solid profitability during the fourth quarter of fiscal 2018," says Chairman, President, and CEO Ara K. Hovnanian.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Goldman, Blackstone resolve dispute over credit derivative trade: WSJ (May 24)

  • MNKD

    MannKind to advance PAH candidate TreT; shares up 4% premarket

    • MannKind (NASDAQ:MNKD) is up 4% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement that it has completed a Phase 1 clinical trial evaluating the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of Treprostinil Technosphere (TreT) in patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH).
